english: to plan; stand on tiptoe; look forward to

etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") + 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") = a person standing on tiptoes -> to plan; stand on tiptoe; look forward to
etymology.interpretation: The character 企(企) (qǐ, "to plan; stand on tiptoe; look forward to") visually conveys the action of a person standing on tiptopes, symbolizing anticipation or looking forward to something. The combination of 人(人) (rén, "person") and 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") intuitively suggests this posture and figurative meaning.

examples.chinese: 他企划明天的聚会(他企劃明天的聚會)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qǐ huà míngtiān de jùhuì.

examples.chinese: 大家企望美好的未来(大家企望美好的未來)。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā qǐ wàng měihǎo de wèilái.
examples.english: Everyone looks forward to a bright future.

examples.chinese: 他企起脚尖(他企起腳尖)，想看比赛(想看比賽)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qǐ qǐ jiǎojiān, xiǎng kàn bǐsài.
examples.english: He stands on tiptoe to watch the match.
